titles.title: To provide for an additional temporary extension of programs under the Small Business Act and the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 through December 15, 2007, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.
Mr. Grijalva moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR 7/31/2007 H8899-8900)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3206.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR 7/31/2007 H8899-8900)
Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 8/8/2007--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Extends through December 15, 2007, under the same terms and conditions, the authorization for any program, authority, or provision, including any pilot program, that is currently authorized through July 31, 2007, under the Small Business Act or the Small Business Investment Act of 1958.
